feedback: Severely stiff elbow reduces follow-through fluidity, affecting consistency.
Fully extend but relax elbow for smooth, consistent follow-through.
Severely over-snapped wrist disrupts shot consistency.
Moderate wrist snap for consistent follow-through.
Tense shoulder reduces follow-through smoothness.
Keep shoulder relaxed for smooth follow-through.
Overextended hips affect landing balance.
Extend hips fully but stay balanced.
Severely flared elbow disrupts alignment, causing major accuracy loss.
Keep elbow tightly tucked to align with basket.
Severely flexed wrist disrupts grip, causing fumbling.
Reduce wrist flexion significantly for stable grip.
Severely raised shoulder disrupts body alignment, causing major accuracy loss.
Lower shoulder significantly for consistent setup.
Severely premature hip extension disrupts timing, causing imbalance.
Maintain significant hip bend for balanced transition.
Severely delayed guide knee extension slows transition, rushing shot.
Extend guide knee significantly for smoother transition.
Severely extended elbow leads to ball loaded too low, slowing release.
Significantly bend elbow to keep ball at chest level for fluid motion.
Severely excessive knee bend causes major instability, slowing shot.
Reduce knee bend significantly for better mobility and balance.
Excessive guide hip bend unbalances stance.
Reduce guide hip bend slightly for better balance.
Severely excessive guide knee bend causes major imbalance.
Reduce guide knee bend significantly for better balance.
